title: Runtime panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
body:
### Describe the bug

Running Mainnet with
`--enable-experimental-state`
`--enable-eip-4881`

then Beacon was stopped responding.  Restart beacon/geth couple times and the issue was still persisted. 

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

```text
Not seeing this issue with previous version.
```


### ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

Run beacon with these flags for awhile, beacon stop responding
`--enable-experimental-state`
`--enable-eip-4881`

Then proceed to remove the above two flags, the error start to show right after the beacon restart. Then beacon reload itself.

### Error

```text

Oct 20 20:41:22 node prysm.sh[6858]: time="2023-10-20 20:41:22" level=error msg="Runtime panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
Oct 20 20:41:22 node prysm.sh[6858]: goroutine 1 [running]:

```


### Platform(s)

Linux (x86)

### What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)

v4.1.0

### Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?

_No response_

I tried to put these two flags back, and the same errors were not shown anymore.
`--enable-experimental-state`
`--enable-eip-4881`

OK once this is happening, the only solution for me was remove the whole beaconchain db, and disable these 2 flags:
`--enable-experimental-state`
`--enable-eip-4881` 
then everything start to work again.
